page.title: 13THE BRECHIN ADVERTISER
page.content: This newspaper was founded by David Burns and the first copy published on 3/10/1848.It cost 2 old pence. Adverts only filled one page of that edition which included national and international news as well as local stories. Nowadays 3500 copies are printed weekly. No reporters are employed and all the news that appars is provided by the public. It is sold in Brechin and in shops up to 15 miles away. About 100 copies a week are sent abroad to Brechin exiles in places like Canada, India and Australia. The present cost is 12p. Usually there are 16 pages. An analysis of a recent edition revealed the following proportions. Adverts, from local firms and organisations, now account for 75% of the space; local news occupies 15%; photographs 7%. The remaining space has letters.
